messageBody:
On Mon, Jul 20, 2009 at 10:53 AM, cant_jim<jimcant@...> wrote:
> Thanks for the idea; looks like System.setOut() will do just what I want.
>
> But your answer raises another question; why do I have to 'reset' the Printstream for each test; I thought all the tests were independent and that there wouldn't be leftover state from prior test to confund a later test.

Your current object is discarded, and a new one created--static state
and system state you have to reset yourself.

> Could this be related to a problem I had with the test suite with several similar test that wrote to a file: the output file of th 2nd tests contained the output of the 1st and 2nd test, the ouput of the 3rd contained the output of the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd tests. Â I ended up having to write separate classes to get all the tests done.

In 4.7, you can use TempFolder to flag files that you'd like JUnit to
delete for you, but JUnit does not attempt the general case of
resetting arbitrary filesystem state between tests.

David Saff
